title: The Modern Farmer's Skillset
text: Equipment reliability analysis. Sprayer calibration prevents over application. We start work before sunrise during harvest. The tractor needs a safety check before operation. We rotate pastures to improve forage quality. We interpret telemetry from precision agriculture systems. Veterinary biosecurity keeps the herd healthy. We record yields and monitor feed intake. We assess soil nutrients for fertilization plans. Farm safety rules are part of our routine. The greenhouse helps control temperature and humidity. In winter we protect equipment from freezing. Irrigation is scheduled to reduce water waste. We design protocols for herd health management.

multiple_choice.question: What do we check every morning?
What protects animals in cold weather?
What do we rotate to improve forage?
Where do we grow plants with climate control?
